91.5: The micro-cone patterned PET film exhibits an average transmittance of 91.5%, which is 1% higher than that of the bare film.

92.0: When hydrolyzed, fluoroalkyltrimethoxysilane (FAS) was coated on the alumina films and the water contact angle was found to be increased with an increase of immersion time, and it was also found that the immersion time of 30 s was long enough to give super-water-repellency and high transparency of 165° and 92% transmittance, respectively [189,190].
95.0: The gradient microstructuring of the coating of rough structures-porous alumina-glass substrate, caused a moth-eye antireflective coating effect, increasing the sample's transmittance of visible light by about 4%, with an overall transparency of 95% (Fig. 2 ).

96.44: The coating prepared from PEG1000- modified hydrosol attained average transmittance of 96.44% and better scratch resistance than the other samples.
The PEG1000-modified coating, with average transmittance of 96.44% and hardness of 4H, made a trade-off between roughness and hardness.
The PEG1000-modified coating prepared by organic-free sol-gel method and CVD process is practical owing to anti-smudge effect and average transmittance of 96.44%.
